paragraphs.zh-tw: 我在紐約開一家設計工作室每七年我都關閉一年讓我進行一些小實驗一些通常不容易在正常的工作年度裡達成的事關閉的一年， 我們不接受任何顧客
paragraphs.en: I run a design studio in New York. Every seven years, I close it for one year to pursue some little experiments, things that are always difficult to accomplish during the regular working year. In that year, we are not available for any of our clients.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 完全關門可想而知那是一段美好又充滿能量的時光
paragraphs.en: We are totally closed. And as you can imagine, it is a lovely and very energetic time.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我起先在紐約開了這家工作室為的是結合我的兩項熱愛： 音樂和設計我们製作影片和包裝其中有很多是你們熟悉的音樂家更多是你們没有聽聞過的音樂家
paragraphs.en: I originally had opened the studio in New York to combine my two loves, music and design. And we created videos and packaging for many musicians that you know, and for even more that you've never heard of.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我發覺就像生活中很多我喜愛的事物一旦習以為常便漸漸變得沉悶
paragraphs.en: As I realized, just like with many many things in my life that I actually love, I adapt to it. And I get, over time, bored by them.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的工作室也不例外我們的作品開始變得雷同看到了吧，書中藏着一顆玻璃眼睛
paragraphs.en: And for sure, in our case, our work started to look the same. You see here a glass eye in a die cut of a book.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 同樣的設計，用於香水包装書中藏着一瓶香水因此我們决定關門一年
paragraphs.en: Quite the similar idea, then, a perfume packaged in a book, in a die cut. So I decided to close it down for one year.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我還有另一個原因目前我們大概用生命的前二十五年學習之後的四十年用於工作放到最後的是約十五年的退休生活
paragraphs.en: Also is the knowledge that right now we spend about in the first 25 years of our lives learning, then there is another 40 years that's really reserved for working. And then tacked on at the end of it are about 15 years for retirement.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我覺得更合理的，可能是拿走五年的退休時間把它們穿插在工作的年歲裡（鼓掌）我自己顯然因此很開心
paragraphs.en: And I thought it might be helpful to basically cut off five of those retirement years and intersperse them in between those working years. That's clearly enjoyable for myself.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但更重要的是是來自休假那幾年的成果可以回餽公司回餽社会而不僅是貢獻給一兩個孫子孫女兩年前有一位TED的講者名叫Jonathan Haidt他把工作定定義三個不同的層次
paragraphs.en: But probably even more important is that the work that comes out of these years flows back into the company and into society at large, rather than just benefiting a grandchild or two. There is a fellow TEDster who spoke two years ago, Jonathan Haidt, who defined his work into three different levels.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 教我深深認同我可以把工作視為一份工，為的是錢
paragraphs.en: And they rang very true for me. I can see my work as a job. I do it for money.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 星期四就開始盼望周末我可能會需要一種業餘愛好，平衡生活
paragraphs.en: I likely already look forward to the weekend on Thursdays. And I probably will need a hobby as a leveling mechanism.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 或者，我可以把工作看成我的事業，這樣我會做得更加用心但有時我又會想花這麼多精力值得嗎？第三個層次，是把工作視為一種召喚很可能我無論如何都會去做即使没有金錢回報也没關係
paragraphs.en: In a career I'm definitely more engaged. But at the same time, there will be periods when I think is all that really hard work really worth my while? While in the third one, in the calling, very much likely I would do it also if I wouldn't be financially compensated for it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我不信教但我尊重自然我的第一個修假是在紐約市度過的
paragraphs.en: I am not a religious person myself, but I did look for nature. I had spent my first sabbatical in New York City.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我希望第二次會有所不同歐洲和美國對我吸引力不大我太熟悉它們了，所以我選擇亞洲
paragraphs.en: Looked for something different for the second one. Europe and the U.S. didn't really feel enticing because I knew them too well. So Asia it was.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我見到的亞洲最美麗的風景在斯里蘭卡和巴厘島斯里蘭卡仍有内戰進行，因此我選擇了巴厘島。
paragraphs.en: The most beautiful landscapes I had seen in Asia were Sri Lanka and Bali. Sri Lanka still had the civil war going on, so Bali it was.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那是一個美好且十分重視手工藝的社会我2008年9月到達那裡立即投入工作
paragraphs.en: It's a wonderful, very craft-oriented society. I arrived there in September 2008, and pretty much started to work right away.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那地方本身就充滿靈氣然而，我首先需要的是滅蚊劑因為蚊子太多了
paragraphs.en: There is wonderful inspiration coming from the area itself. However the first thing that I needed was mosquito repellent typography because they were definitely around heavily.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 其次我需要某種方法驅走那些野狗他们繞着我的房子當我早上散步時來襲擊我我們因此做了99條狗的系列T恤
paragraphs.en: And then I needed some sort of way to be able to get back to all the wild dogs that surround my house, and attacked me during my morning walks. So we created this series of 99 portraits on tee shirts.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 一隻狗一件T恤作為一個小報復我加了一條小小的、略帶威協的信息這麼多狗，這麼少食譜...在T恤的背後
paragraphs.en: Every single dog on one tee shirt. As a little retaliation with a just ever so slightly menacing message on the back of the shirt.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在我離開紐約前我覺得可以装修一下我的工作室我把工作全交給別人
paragraphs.en: Just before I left New York I decided I could actually renovate my studio. And then just leave it all to them.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不再自己操心只管買家具
paragraphs.en: And I don't have to do anything. So I looked for furniture.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 結果是我喜歡的都買不起買得起的我又都不喜欢
paragraphs.en: And it turned out that all the furniture that I really liked, I couldn't afford. And all the stuff I could afford, I didn't like.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 於是我在巴厘島要做的其中一件事就是設計家具設計這個的時後，當然，我們仍跟野狗較量中
paragraphs.en: So one of the things that we pursued in Bali was pieces of furniture. This one, of course, still works with the wild dogs.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 還没全部完成我記得完成这盞灯的時候我終於跟狗講和了
paragraphs.en: It's not quite finished yet. And I think by the time this lamp came about, I had finally made peace with those dogs.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我還設計了這張茶几命名為 “現在這裡”
paragraphs.en: Then there is a coffee table. I also did a coffee table. It's called Be Here Now.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 它裡面装了330個指南針我們製做了特別的咖啡杯裡面藏着磁鐵它使這些指南針拼命地動全朝向咖啡杯為中心
paragraphs.en: It includes 330 compasses. And we had custom espresso cups made that hide a magnet inside, and make those compasses go crazy, always centering on them.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 之後又設計這個相當健談愛講話的椅子在巴厘島，我開始平生第一次打坐
paragraphs.en: Then this is a fairly talkative, verbose kind of chair. I also started meditating for the first time in my life in Bali.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不過，同時我又清楚的意識到聽别人講他們高興的事有多無聊所以我就不多說了
paragraphs.en: And at the same time, I'm extremely aware how boring it is to hear about other people's happinesses. So I will not really go too far into it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你們很多人都認識這位TED的講者Danny Gilbert， 他寫了一本書我從TED讀書會買了這本書一直等到四年後我終於在修長假時讀了這本書
paragraphs.en: Many of you will know this TEDster, Danny Gilbert, whose book, actually, I got it through the TED book club. I think it took me four years to finally read it, while on sabbatical.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我很高興知道作者也是在休長假時寫這本書的我還要介紹給你們幾位得益於修長假的人
paragraphs.en: And I was pleased to see that he actually wrote the book while he was on sabbatical. And I'll show you a couple of people that did well by pursuing sabbaticals.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這位是Ferran Adria：公認的當今世界上最好的厨師他的餐館位於Barcelona北部的elBull他的餐館每年只開七個月
paragraphs.en: This is Ferran Adria. Many people think he is right now the best chef in the world with his restaurant north of Barcelona, El Bulli. His restaurant is open seven months every year.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 另外五個月關門他用這段時間來做試驗，全體厨房員工也不放假他的最新數據相當可觀
paragraphs.en: He closes it down for five months to experiment with a full kitchen staff. His latest numbers are fairly impressive.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 他的餐館一年可以容納8,000 人却收到220萬個預定
paragraphs.en: He can seat, throughout the year, he can seat 8,000 people. And he has 2.2 million requests for reservations.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 看看我的周期，開七年，休一年是我百分之12.5的時間看看比我更成功的公司3M公司，自20世紀30年代起讓所有的工程師花百分之十五工作時間做他們自己想做的事
paragraphs.en: If I look at my cycle, seven years, one year sabbatical, it's 12.5 percent of my time. And if I look at companies that are actually more successful than mine, 3M since the 1930s is giving all their engineers 15 percent to pursue whatever they want.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有些很成功的例子思高牌膠帶就是這個公司政策下的產物還有Art Fry 研制的Post-It，也是他利用私人時間為3M發明的
paragraphs.en: There is some good successes. Scotch tape came out of this program, as well as Art Fry developed sticky notes from during his personal time for 3M.

paragraphs.zh-tw: Google 眾人皆知給他們的軟體工程師百分之二十的時間去做他們自己想做的項目聽眾裡有没有人嘗試修過長假呢？大概百分之五吧
paragraphs.en: Google, of course, very famously gives 20 percent for their software engineers to pursue their own personal projects. Anybody in here has actually ever conducted a sabbatical? That's about five percent of everybody.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 坐你身邊的人舉手了嗎?請和他們聊聊， 看他們的休假是否成功
paragraphs.en: So I'm not sure if you saw your neighbor putting their hand up. Talk to them about if it was successful or not.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我發現探討我未來想做的事最佳的辦法是與做過的人談談那比自己空想來的更有效當我想到一個好主意時我便把决定寫在日記本裡
paragraphs.en: I've found that finding out about what I'm going to like in the future, my very best way is to talk to people who have actually done it much better than myself envisioning it. When I had the idea of doing one, the process was I made the decision and I put it into my daily planner book.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 然後我告訴很多很多的人，越多越好好讓我日後不會輕易地知難而退我的第一個休假初期事情進展一點也不順利
paragraphs.en: And then I told as many, many people as I possibly could about it so that there was no way that I could chicken out later on. In the beginning, on the first sabbatical, it was rather disastrous.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我以為不用計畫空閒本身就很好能夠創新。但我錯了没有計畫，我會被動去應付瑣碎小事，我不是指工作上的事情那些我全拒絕了，我指的是其他瑣事
paragraphs.en: I had thought that I should do this without any plan, that this vacuum of time somehow would be wonderful and enticing for idea generation. It was not. I just, without a plan, I just reacted to little requests, not work requests, those I all said no to, but other little requests.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 比如說給日本設計雜誌寫信就是說，我成了自己手下的實習生
paragraphs.en: Sending mail to Japanese design magazines and things like that. So I became my own intern.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 很快我把自己感興趣的事情列了個清單把它們分門別類，分給大塊的時間然後做個計畫，就像在小學校做的一樣計畫有什麼呢？ 星期一8至9點：寫小說9至10點，預想未來
paragraphs.en: And I very quickly made a list of the things I was interested in, put them in a hierarchy, divided them into chunks of time and then made a plan, very much like in grade school. What does it say here? Monday, 8 to 9: story writing; 9 to 10: future thinking.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那不是很成功。等等，等等。而實際上，作為第一次休假的開始這些安排很適合我
paragraphs.en: Was not very successful. And so on and so forth. And that actually, specifically as a starting point of the first sabbatical, worked really well for me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 結果呢我又重新愛上設計了我自得其樂
paragraphs.en: What came out of it? I really got close to design again. I had fun.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 從長遠經濟角度看，我的第一個長假是成功的由於質量提高，我們可以設更高的價格
paragraphs.en: Financially, seen over the long term, it was actually successful. Because of the improved quality, we could ask for higher prices.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 或許最重要的是基本上在下七年我們的設計意念均源自我們休假的那一年請你看看以下幾項作品都是那個長假之後七年設計的
paragraphs.en: And probably most importantly, basically everything we've done in the seven years following the first sabbatical came out of thinking of that one single year. And I'll show you a couple of projects that came out of the seven years following that sabbatical.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 第一種體會是我們不斷强調的一致性其實這種凡事必須完全相同的想法僅僅極少數公司行得通並非每間公司都合適
paragraphs.en: One of the strands of thinking I was involved in was that sameness is so incredibly overrated. This whole idea that everything needs to be exactly the same works for a very very few strand of companies, and not for everybody else.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 音樂之家（Casa de Musica) 曾請我們設計雜誌就是那個由 Rem Koolhaas 設計建造的音樂中心在波爾圖，葡萄牙僅管我想要把這個標誌設計的與建築物造型没關係結果却没有成功
paragraphs.en: We were asked to design an identity for Casa da Musica, the Rem Koolhaas-built music center in Porto, in Portugal. And even though I desired to do an identity that doesn't use the architecture, I failed at that.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 一個主要原因是因為Rem Koolhaas給波爾圖市做的一場簡報他說到要把多層含意交織在一起我起先没有明白直到我把他的建築設計語言翻成一般英語去理解基本上，建築設計就是標誌設計
paragraphs.en: And mostly also because I realized out of a Rem Koolhaas presentation to the city of Porto, where he talked about a conglomeration of various layers of meaning. Which I understood after I translated it from architecture speech in to regular English, basically as logo making.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我才明白，那建築本身就是一個標誌事情因此變得十分容易
paragraphs.en: And I understood that the building itself was a logo. So then it became quite easy.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們在建築上蒙了個罩子從遠遠的地面查看從各個角度查看西，北，南，東從上到下用非常特殊的方式著色讓我的一個朋友寫了一個軟體叫音樂之家Logo製造器
paragraphs.en: We put a mask on it, looked at it deep down in the ground, checked it out from all sides, west, north, south, east, top and bottom. Colored them in a very particular way by having a friend of mine write a piece of software, the Casa da Musica Logo Generator.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 把它連接到掃描機把任何圖像放上，例如貝多芬
paragraphs.en: That's connected to a scanner. You put any image in there, like that Beethoven image.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 軟體可以立即給你音樂之家貝多芬Logo當你想設計一個有貝多芬像的海報那軟體很有用，因為Logo的視覺元素和海報是完全一樣的
paragraphs.en: And the software, in a second, will give you the Casa da Musica Beethoven logo. Which, when you actually have to design a Beethoven poster, comes in handy, because the visual information of the logo and the actual poster is exactly the same.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以在概念的層面而言，它們一定能互相配合如果演出Zappa的音樂，它會有自己獨特的Logo
paragraphs.en: So it will always fit together, conceptually, of course. If Zappa's music is performed, it gets its own logo.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 或Philip Grass，或Lou Reed，或 Chemical Brothers誰在那裡表演，誰就有自己的Logo這是音樂之家自己的 Logo在音樂之家内部也是一樣，不論是音樂之家主席，或是音樂總監他們的音樂之家畫像就印在他們的名片上
paragraphs.en: Or Philip Glass or Lou Reed or the Chemical Brothers, who all performed there, get their own Casa da Musica logo. It works the same internally with the president or the musical director, whose Casa da Musica portraits wind up on their business cards.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有一個完整的管弦樂隊駐扎在那所建築裡他們擁有自己清晰的Logo
paragraphs.en: There is a full-blown orchestra living inside the building. It has a more transparent identity.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這是他們巡演用的卡車它們還有一個較小的現代樂團一個以"交織 "(remix) 為名的十二人樂團, 名字就交織在 Logo 中
paragraphs.en: The truck they go on tour with. Or there's a smaller contemporary orchestra, 12 people that remixes its own title.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 十分方便的是你可以用這個Logo創造廣告就像這幅 Donna Toney海報或蕭邦 (Chopin)，或莫扎特 (Mozart)或 La Monte Young
paragraphs.en: And one of the handy things that came about was that you could take the logo type and create advertising out of it. Like this Donna Toney poster, or Chopin, or Mozart, or La Monte Young.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 您可以根據它的形狀設計字樣你還可以把它從外表長出來
paragraphs.en: You can take the shape and make typography out of it. You can grow it underneath the skin.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你可以設計一張海報，介紹在音樂之家外面舉行的家族活動或在音樂之家下面舉行的狂野派對或每周定期舉行的活動又或是教育服務第二種體會：在那次長假之前多數時候我都使用設計語言幫助促銷那並没有什麼不好
paragraphs.en: You can have a poster for a family event in front of the house, or a rave underneath the house or a weekly program, as well as educational services. Second insight. So far, until that point I had been mostly involved or used the language of design for promotional purposes, which was fine with me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 一方面我不反對銷售我父母都是銷售員
paragraphs.en: On one hand I have nothing against selling. My parents are both salespeople.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但我覺得我花了這多時間學習這種語言為什麼僅用來幫助促銷？應該還可以利用它做些其他事這些作品都出自這個想法
paragraphs.en: But I did feel that I spent so much time learning this language, why do I only promote with it? There must be something else. And the whole series of work came out of it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有些你們可能已經見過我在以前的TED會上曾經展示過以前的TED會標題是“至今我所學到的”我現在就介紹兩項
paragraphs.en: Some of you might have seen it. I showed some of it at earlier TEDs before, under the title "Things I've Learned in My Life So Far." I'll just show two now.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這是一整面牆的香蕉不同的生熟程度在一家紐約的畫廊開張那天上面說 “自信產生優秀結果”一周後
paragraphs.en: This is a whole wall of bananas at different ripenesses on the opening day in this gallery in New York. It says, "Self-confidence produces fine results." This is after a week.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 兩周後三，四，五周後你可以見到自信心幾乎都回来了只是幾乎，不是全部
paragraphs.en: After two weeks, three weeks, four weeks, five weeks. And you see the self confidence almost comes back, but not quite.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這是一些客人送給我的照片阿姆斯特丹給了我們一個廣場，並要我們做些事情
paragraphs.en: These are some pictures visitors sent to me. And then the city of Amsterdam gave us a plaza and asked us to do something.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們用石板作為網格作為我們一件小作品的背景我們從中央銀行提了25萬個硬幣顏色有不同的深度
paragraphs.en: We used the stone plates as a grid for our little piece. We got 250,000 coins from the central bank, at different darknesses.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有的嶄新發亮半舊的， 和非常舊的，發黑的用了一周多的時間，得到了100多志願者的帮忙創造了這個花卉模樣的字樣文字是，“沉迷使生活更糟"却使作品更好”我們的構思是把圖樣做得很精美要令觀賞者覺得難以决定我是要把這些錢盡量拿走還是保持圖像完好無缺在拼砌這個圖像的過程與數百名志願者在一起的那個星期有很多居住在周圍的居民都走近它看，也很喜歡它
paragraphs.en: So we got brand new ones, shiny ones, medium ones, and very old, dark ones. And with the help of 100 volunteers, over a week, created this fairly floral typography that spelled, "Obsessions make my life worse and my work better." And the idea of course was to make the type so precious that as an audience you would be in between, "Should I really take as much money as I can? Or should I leave the piece intact as it is right now?" While we built all this up during that week, with the 100 volunteers, a good number of the neighbors surrounding the plaza got very close to it and quite loved it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 當它終於完工時第一夜一個人拿了一個大塑膠袋把錢幣大堆大堆的装進袋子裡，直到他提不動為止一位鄰居報了警阿姆斯特丹警方急中生智趕到現場， 看到一切他們想保護這件藝術作品
paragraphs.en: So when it was finally done, and in the first night a guy came with big plastic bags and scooped up as many coins as he could possibly carry, one of the neighbors called the police. And the Amsterdam police in all their wisdom, came, saw, and they wanted to protect the artwork.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 就把錢幣都掃了起來放到警察局好好保存看見他們掃了吧
paragraphs.en: And they swept it all up and put it into custody at police headquarters. I think you see, you see them sweeping. You see them sweeping right here.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那是警察，把作品全掃光了8小時之後所剩的就只有那麼多幾乎全部掃光
paragraphs.en: That's the police, getting rid of it all. So after eight hours that's pretty much all that was left of the whole thing.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們還在巴厘島開始了一個更大的項目是一個講關於快樂的電影
paragraphs.en: We are also working on the start of a bigger project in Bali. It's a movie about happiness.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在這裡，我們請了附近的一些猪為我們做標題却嫌它們不够仔細
paragraphs.en: And here we asked some nearby pigs to do the titles for us. They weren't quite slick enough.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們試用了鵝希望她會做出優雅美觀的作品它却似乎太講究了
paragraphs.en: So we asked the goose to do it again, and hoped she would do somehow, a more elegant or pretty job. And I think she overdid it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有點過分装飾而我的工作室是在猴子森林邊
paragraphs.en: Just a bit too ornamental. And my studio is very close to the monkey forest.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這猴子森林的猴子看起來相當高興我們又請了這些家伙幫忙
paragraphs.en: And the monkeys in that monkey forest looked, actually, fairly happy. So we asked those guys to do it again.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 他們做得很出色， 但是有可讀性問題當然，如果你不自己親自做就別指望完全滿意
paragraphs.en: They did a fine job, but had a couple of readability problems. So of course whatever you don't really do yourself doesn't really get done properly.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們今後兩年將製作這部電影還需要一陣子
paragraphs.en: That film we'll be working on for the next two years. So it's going to be a while.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你可能會想製作關於快樂的電影可能會不值得你當然總是可以去看看這個家伙
paragraphs.en: And of course you might think that doing a film on happiness might not really be worthwhile. Then you can of course always go and see this guy.

paragraphs.zh-tw: （笑瑜伽）我很高興我活着我很高興我活着 我很高興我活着
paragraphs.en: Video: And I'm happy I'm alive. I'm happy I'm alive. I'm happy I'm alive.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 謝謝你們（鼓掌）
paragraphs.en: Stefan Sagmeister: Thank you.
